definition: confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out

sentences.english: Now before you fall asleep, do you have any dizziness or palpitations?
sentences.chinese: 那在你入睡前你有感到頭暈眩或心悸嗎？

sentences.english: A shot to the head deals bonus damage and stuns for a short duration.
sentences.chinese: 一槍爆頭造成額外的傷害，並造成極短時間的暈眩。

sentences.english: This aqueduct of the sewer is formidable; it interlaces in a dizzy fashion.
sentences.chinese: 這個污水溝渠實在太可怕，它的交叉使人暈眩。

sentences.english: Ground Stomp is foot-stomping skill, stuns and knocks back monsters in a small radius around the barbarian.
sentences.chinese: 用腳跺地，擊退小半徑內的怪物並造成暈眩。

sentences.english: Remember that next time you’re dazzled by a brain scan.
sentences.chinese: 下次若再被腦部掃描弄得暈眩時，要好好記住。

sentences.english: The plane is pitching to the left in a sickening way.
sentences.chinese: 飛機令人暈眩地向左傾斜。

sentences.english: Take fainting in response to seeingblood or surgical instruments.
sentences.chinese: 例如，見到血或外科手術器械會暈眩。

sentences.english: The euphoric feeling and the sweating that comes after chewing the betel nuts, makes the happiness complete.
sentences.chinese: 嚼檳榔後出汗與暈眩的快感則是完全的快樂。

sentences.english: The stun from the Tidal Charm trinket no longer breaks when damage is dealt to the stunned target.
sentences.chinese: 潮汐咒符的暈眩效果不會因爲受到的傷害而被打斷。

sentences.english: Sucre seems to be hurting and Michael appears to be very  dizzy.
sentences.chinese: 蘇克雷看上去傷還沒好，而邁克似乎感到十分暈眩。

sentences.english: The thing which I really want to draw is beautiful so as to feel dizzy.
sentences.chinese: 我真正想畫的東西美得讓人暈眩。

sentences.english: A couple of whiskys seem to have gone to my head.
sentences.chinese: 幾杯威士忌酒似乎使我暈眩。

sentences.english: It may have been because I had my coat on, and the apartment was warm, but suddenly I began to feel lightheaded.
sentences.chinese: 我穿上了外套，在溫暖的公寓裏，我開始感覺暈眩。

definition: vertigo/dizziness/fainting/feeling of swaying, head spinning, lack of balance or floating (e.g. from a stroke)/Taiwan pr. [xuan4 yun1]
to have a high temperature/feverish/unable to think calmly/to emit heat
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
